Research Focus

I am fascinated by how memory is encoded, represented, and traversed in both human cognition and artificial systems. I focus on high-dimensional vector spaces of memory, associative memory modeling, and computational architectures to investigate how both systems navigate and adapt their memory space. By applying various frameworks to bridge neuroscience and AI, I aim to uncover new insights into how memory structures evolve, and how these processes can inform and advance our understanding of both human cognition and AI.
